byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Karam Shoumali from Kilis and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: To many, the deal hammered out in Munich overnight seemed like just another irrelevant set of words dictated by diplomats in a foreign capital.

headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire Plan Is Met With Skepticism in Syria
headline.main: In Syria, Skepticism That Cease-Fire Will Stop Fighting

snippet: To many, the deal hammered out in Munich overnight seemed like just another irrelevant set of words dictated by diplomats in a foreign capital.
abstract: Syrian refugees express deep skepticism that cease-fire agreement will stop nearly five-year war in country, as Pres Bashar al-Assad's forces continue north with aid of Russian airstrikes and Western and Arab backers of insurgency decline to increase support.
